Sentencas: The presence of steam in the reactant gas of a catalytic fuel reformer decreases the formation of carbon, minimizing catalyst deactivation.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: However, the operation of the reformer without supplemental water reduces the size, weight, cost, and overall complexity of the system.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: The work presented here examines experimentally two options for adding steam to the reformer inlet: (I) recycle of a simulated fuel cell anode exit gas (comprised of mainly CO2, H2O, and N-2 and some H-2 and CO) and (II) recycle of the reformate from the reformer exit back to the reformer inlet (mainly comprised of H-2, CO, and N-2, and some H2O and CO2).
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: As expected, anode gas recycle reduced the carbon formation and increased the hydrogen concentration in the reformate.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: However, reformer recycle was not as effective due principally to the lower water content in the reformate compared to the anode gas.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: In fact, reformate recycle showed slightly increased carbon formation compared to no recycle.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming

Sentencas: In an attempt to understand the effects of individual gases in these recycle streams (H-2, CO, CO2, N-2, and H2O), individual gas species were independently introduced to the reformer feed.
Titulo: Effects of fuel cell anode recycle on catalytic fuel reforming
